content.description:
On the main, huge, imposing highball boulder in the cluster (just off of the road to the right).  

  This starts as a campus off of the right aretes base, traverses left across the main face next to the road, and finishes as per the highball line called "Highball Arete" which is on the left arete of the main face.
This is coming over from Dr. Topo so ill do my best. This is a pretty good Horizontal finger Crack going right to left in the middle of the tall imposing boulder on the right side of Highball
content.location: This climb is on the far right of highball, Starts about 5 feet right of Center Crimper Prob

content.description:
On the main, huge, imposing highball boulder in the cluster (just off of the road to the right).  

  Walk past the right arete to the right side face. climb up awesome holds in mid face and look for the "suitcase handle"... Note that "handle" holds of this type tend to break. Dont be that guy/girl...

Climbs up right side of Highball Boulder to a decomposing horizontal seam. Make a long move to a sloper and reach for the jug sidepull in the seam. Make sure you've brushed the top, it's one of the tougher top outs on the boulder. Look for a shallow dish crimp about 2' back on the right or bump past it to a  finger bucket about 3' back.
content.protection: Pads, brushing, looking at the top first.
content.location: Right side of the Highball Boulder, climbs to seam at top of face.

content.description: Some 5.6 climbing on a slab that is comprised of sloped jugs leading into a super easy-going crack that is great for those new to climbing looking to practice some foot/hand jamming.
content.location: On the left side of the boulder next to 'Highball Arete".

content.description:
Scary! Sketchy! 

  To the left of the big highball boulder is a boulder face with a massive flake at its base. Start on the huge flake by levering yourself up only by your leg, to reach the small holds above. finish straight up... Shew...

On the main, huge, imposing highball boulder in the cluster (just off of the road to the right).  

  This is the left line on the main, highball, front face next to the road.

This is the block face that is back-set and to the right of the main, huge, imposing highball boulder in the cluster (just off of the road to the right).  

  This is the left line and climbs little crimpers up and over the bulge... harder than it looks top out straight up...

On the main, huge, imposing highball boulder in the cluster (just off of the road to the right). This is the left, tall arete when looking at the boulder from the fire road. 

  The crux is 15+ feet off the deck. 

  Stand start, and climb that janx.

On the main, huge, imposing highball boulder in the cluster (just off of the road to the right).  

  This is the right arete of the main boulder face.  

  climb high prominent arete to the scary, sketchy, harder than it looks finish way off the deck.
Center line that climbs to obvious left facing flake jug about 12' up. Good flat sloper on the lip helps you top out.
SDS.  Start matched on low crimp under the bulge and slap up on small jibs to gain small crimps to gain the crack to a cruxy high topout
content.location: This is located right of suitcase problem

content.description: To the left of the big highball boulder is a boulder face with a massive flake at its base. Start on the right arete, sitting on the boulder at the right. climb entire arete, topping out through slopers, same as leg breaker.

Located 1.75 miles up the fireroad, and on the right hand side. The approach is easy and there are a high concentration of tall, scary problems to choose from which see very low amounts of climber traffic. Try out the Highball Arete, or the 6'-4" Arete. Fun!!
